Kelly W. Zhang

about

I am in my final year of undergraduate study at New York University. I study computer science and am particularly interested in machine learning and natural language understanding. I am very fortunate to be a member of the Machine Learning for Language Lab (MLÂ²) at CILVR and to be advised by Sam Bowman.

research

Adversarially Regularized Autoencoders for Generating Discrete Structures
Junbo (Jake) Zhao, Yoon Kim, Kelly Zhang, Alexander Rush, and Yann LeCun.
arXiv Preprint
[pdf] [code]

work

  • I am a grader for the fall 2017 instantiation of the NYU Data Science course Natural Language Processing with Representation Learning (DS-GA 1011), which is jointly taught by Sam Bowman and Kyunghyun Cho.

  • I spent summer 2017 working at the eBay New York office on the homepage recommendations team. My project was on detecting "Not Suitable for Work" items based on images and text. My work is being put into production as a part of eBay's recommendation pipeline.
